result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane T Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Half of the sentence may be served on home monitor
*Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane T Meyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane T Meyer in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:46 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing at this time.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

There is a plea agreement.
Atty Cousins states agreement: Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 and Count 3 are being dismissed and read in. Defense is free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs with agreement.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins  makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding probation request, would be concurrent to Defendant's current sentence.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 60 Days
Half of the sentence may be served on home monitor
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge of $200
Notice of Assignment of Judge Returned - No Mail Recepticle

2:42 p.m. Defendant Shane T Meyer in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
P/NG entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
